messages.subject: CONTACT ME ASAP
messages.body:
Dear Friend,  I am Mr. Rodney Mbonu, a native of Cape Town
in South Africa and I am an  Executive Accountant with the
South Africa Department of Mining & Natural  Resources.
First and foremost, I apologized using this medium to reach
you  for a transaction/business of this magnitude, but this
is due to  Confidentiality and prompt access reposed on
this medium. Be informed that a  member of the South Africa
Export Promotion Council (SEPC) who was at the  Government
delegation to your country during a trade exhibition gave
your  enviable credentials/particulars to me. I have
decided to seek a  confidential co-operation with you in
the execution of the deal described  Hereunder for the
benefit of all parties and hope you will keep it as a top 
secret because of the nature of this transaction.

Within the Department of Mining & Natural Resources where I
work as an Executive Accountant and with the cooperation of
four other top officials, we have in our possession as
overdue payment bills totaling Twenty - Six Million, Five
Hundred Thousand U. S. Dollars ($26,500,000.)   which we
want to transfer abroad with the assistance and cooperation
of a  foreign company/individual to receive the said fund
on our behalf or a  reliable foreign non-company account to
receive such funds. More so, we are  handicapped in the
circumstances, as the South Africa Civil Service Code of 
Conduct does not allow us to operate offshore account hence
your importance  in the whole transaction.  This amount
$26.5m represents the balance of the total contract value
executed on behalf of my Department by a foreign
contracting firm, which we the officials over-invoiced
deliberately. Though the actual contract cost have been
paid to the original contractor, leaving the balance in the
tune of the said amount which we have in principles gotten
approval to remit by Telegraphic Transfer (T.T) to any
foreign bank account you will provide by filing in an
application through the Justice Ministry here in South
Africa for the transfer of rights and privileges of the
former contractor to you.

I have the authority of my partners involved to propose
that should you be willing to assist us in the transaction,
your share of the sum will be 25% of the $26,.5 million,
70% for us and 5% for taxation and miscellaneous expenses.
The business itself is 100% safe, on your part provided you
treat it with utmost secrecy and confidentiality. Also your
 area of specialization is not a hindrance to the
successful execution of  this transaction. I have reposed
my confidence in you and hope that you will  not disappoint
me. Endeavor to contact me immediately through my e-mail 
address, whether or not you are interested in this deal. If
you are not, it will enable me scout for another  foreign
partner to carry out this deal I want to assure you that my
partners  and myself are in a position to make the payment
of this claim possible  provided you can give us a very
strong Assurance and guarantee that our  share will be
secured and please remember to treat this matter as very 
confidential matter, because we will not comprehend with
any form of  exposure as we are still in active Government
Service and remember once  again that time is of the
essence in this business.I will advise that you  contact me
through my direct email address thus:  mbonurodney@msn.com 
I wait in anticipation of your fullest co-operation.  Yours
faithfully,

messages.body:
Date:	 Mon, 1 Aug 2005

Dear Mr Mbonu,

I'm not sure how I received your e-mail, though I was at
the Greater Lothlorien Expo '05 a few weeks ago. Perhaps we
met then, I'm afraid it was so crowded I don't remember. I
am searching through the business cards I collected during
those hectic days to find yours.

I don't usually follow up on solicitations from strangers
but your e-mail comes at an interesting time. My partners
and I (we are an LLP, Limited Liability Partnership, under
US law) are engaged in a venture of considerable risk. We
knew there would be problems going in but the reward, if it
pays off, is worth it. Without going into details which
would not be appropriate now, let me just say there is
considerable travel involved. The thing is I think it would
help us greatly if we could charter or perhaps purchase a
business jet. I have put this idea before the other
partners and all agree it would help us greatly, but we
simply don't have the capital to put up for this necessary
transaction.

Therefore I am responding to you in hopes of learning more
about the business matter you brought up.

Yrs. Sincerely,
Boromir of Gondor
Fellowship LLP

messages.body:
Subject:	THANK YOU FOR YOUR PROMPT RESPONSE
Date:	Mon, 01 Aug 2005


Dear Boromir Gondor,

I thank you very much for your prompt response to my mail.
I want to assure you that this transaction is 100% risk
free and legitimate, this you will see as we proceed. You
stand to benefit immensely from this. I have perfected all
the relevant documents to ensure that this funds is
transferred to your account without any problem. All that
is required from you in this transaction is your full
cooperation.

To commence this transaction, what I need to do first is to
register you with the Department of Mining & Natural
Resources (DMNR) This is where the contract was executed
and with the Justice Ministry  with out this registration,
it will not be assumed that you executed a contract of
$26.5Million. Twenty - Six Million, Five Hundred Thousand
U. S. Dollars . But with the registration and other
documentation, your file will be verified to actually see
if you executed the contract. I want to assure you that
there is no problem with the verification, as I have
perfected all the processes to ensure that this funds is
transferred to your account. So this is why it very
important you have to make available your information.

After the registration by the office of the DMNR, they will
forward your file to the office of  Finance the  Ministry
(FM) who will do the verification exercise and once the FM
approves your file for payment, they will issue a
remittance advise to the South Africa Reserve Bank for the
funds to be wire transferred to your nominated bank
account, which you will forward to them.

Once your file get to the finance ministry, I want you to
deal with them very business like, as I do not want them to
suspect that you did not execute the contract.

Please if you are okay with this explanation, do forward to
me your 
full information,

YOUR FULL NAME AND ADDRESS
YOUR COMPANY NAME AND ADDRESS IF ANY.
YOUR PRIVATE TELEPHONE/FAX NUMBER
A COPY OF YOUR DRIVERS LICENSE OR ANY MEANS OF
IDENTIFICATION

Upon the receipt of the above information, I will instruct
my personal assistant to proceed to the office of the DMNR
and Justice Ministry  to commence the registration. Once
your file gets to the office of the Finance Ministry, they
might require you to come forward to sign the final funds
release documents, if you cannot, they will require you to
obtain the service of an accredited attorney to sign the
documents for you. Also, the ministry will require some
charges for the processing of the documents. This you do
not have to worry about, as I have made 5% available for
what ever expenses you incur during this transaction. As
soon as the funds is transferred to your account, and I fly
over to your country for the sharing and invest purpose.

I thank you very much for your willingness and anticipated
assistance. Waiting to hear from you.

Dr. Mbonu  Rodney.

messages.body:
Date:	 Sat, 6 Aug 2005

Dear Mr Mbonu,

Thank you for your note re: the registration. I'm pleased
to hear things are moving along, as this is a tense time
for me personally.

Just so you know, Fellowship LLP is basically in charge of
disposing of a highly valuable antique. To this end we have
an extended business trip to make, to deal with making all
the arrangements. It's really wearing. I'm not a cpmplainer
but business makes for some strange partners. There is one
guy, Gimli something-or-other, who I think is Polish or
maybe Russian. He's barely understandable. Then there is a
pair of rather foolish types who I guess are Scottish. I'd
always thought the Scots were sensible business people,
have you found this to be true? --At any rate, these guys
are not.

I cannot tell you how glad I will be to have this jet at
our disposal. You are truly a lifesaver.

I have a couple of notes on the below passage you sent
to me.

Dear Boromir Gondor,

How are you today? I hope all is well? Yesterday final
approval was given from the accounts department and your
payment file was dispatched to the paying authority for
verification and remittance of your funds to your nominated
bank account.

Due to the distance from America to South Africa and
knowing fully well that it will not be easy for you to come
over to south Africa to sign the final fund release
documents immediately, we applied on your behalf that

Off-Shore payment office in America or Europe.

where you are to receive the payment of your contract
allocation. All things being equal you should be hearing
from the paying authority anytime from Monday.

purpose.

messages.body:
Date:	 Tue, 16 Aug 2005

Dear Mr Mbonu

Thank you for your mail. Things are going very badly for my
company right now. We could really use the money. I'm
hoping to speed things up between us.

The Moria trip was a complete disaster. One of our partners
actually DIED on us. Our lawyer notified us we were being
investigated under the Bryson Act on Litigating Real
Offshore Grants and when we got the notice (called a
B.A.L.R.O.G.) our senior partner just up and DIED. This is
very very bad for the Fellowship but we have to press on.
We're heading to Lorien to try and get some rest and decide
how to proceed. Should be there in less than a week! At
that time I need to have some answers for the group on this
corporate jet idea.

I still need some answers, please--in my e-mail dated
8/6/05 I asked the following--

1) Who exactly are your partners and what is their role in
this transaction?

2) in re-reading our correspondence, I can't seem to find
the actual amount I will receive from participating in this
transaction.

Also I'm concerned because (3) I didn't get the attachments
you referred to here:

Attached to this mail is copies of the certificate
of registration and
the approval notice for your record purpose.

Please, I need answers so we can proceed, this is a
tremendously stressful time for us and the money will be a
HUGE help!!!

--With apologies for staying out of touch, things will be
much better now that we're out of Moria. I'll be in daily
touch with you, I promise--

Boromir

PS We need to get results before Lorien!
